docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Personalized Pharmaceutical Care Lab 정밀 의학의 미래를 설계합니다.

유전체 발견과 임상 적용의 교차점에서, 우리는 더 안전하고 효과적인 약물 치료를 위한 길을 엽니다.

연구 분야 탐색 연구진 소개 01. Precision Medicine

환자 개개인의 유전적 특성에 맞춘 최적의 약물 치료를 제공합니다. 부작용은 최소화하고, 효과는 극대화합니다.

02. Genomics

약물 반응의 유전적 비밀을 해독하여, DNA 분석을 통한 안전한 의약품 개발을 선도합니다.

03. Big Data & AI

대규모 의료 데이터를 분석하여 임상 의사결정을 지원하는 인공지능 모델을 개발합니다.

Recent News

Publication: ABCG2 Polymorphism 연구가 Cardiovascular Toxicology에 게재되었습니다.

더 보기 Principal Investigator 김우림 교수

약학대학 조교수

중개 약물유전체학 연구를 이끌며, 기초 과학과 임상 현실 사이의 간극을 좁히고 있습니다.

docs.title: Research Sectors
docs.text:
Personalized Medicine

We investigate individual variability in drug response due to genetic, environmental, and physiological factors. Our goal is to develop predictive models for drug efficacy and toxicity.

Pharmacogenomics (PGx)

We identify genetic markers associated with drug response. By analyzing genomic data, we aim to implement PGx testing in clinical practice to prevent adverse drug reactions.

Clinical Pharmacology

We conduct pharmacokinetic (PK) and pharmacodynamic (PD) modeling to optimize dosage regimens for various patient populations, including pediatrics and the elderly.

Pharmacoepidemiology

Using real-world data (RWD) and big data analytics, we evaluate the safety and effectiveness of medications in large populations.

docs.title: EN
docs.text:
Personalized Pharmaceutical Care Lab Designing the Future of Precision Medicine.

At the intersection of genomic discovery and clinical application, we pave the way for safer and more effective drug therapies.

Explore Research Meet the Team 01. Precision Medicine

Tailoring medical treatment to individual genetic characteristics. Minimizing risks while maximizing efficacy.

02. Genomics

Decoding the genetic secrets of drug response to lead the development of safe medications through DNA analysis.

03. Big Data & AI

Leveraging large-scale healthcare data to develop AI models that support clinical decision-making.

Recent News

Publication: Our work on ABCG2 Polymorphism has been accepted in Cardiovascular Toxicology.

Read More Principal Investigator Prof. Woorim Kim

Assistant Professor, College of Pharmacy

Leading translational pharmacogenomics research, bridging the gap between basic science and clinical reality.
